title.narrative: Provide Emergency Food Security Assistance to the new IDPs in Northern Rural of Aleppo

description.narrative: As humanitarian emergency response to the huge needs of civilians who forcibly evacuated Rural Idleb and Aleppo (due to the escalation of military operations). And Based on the Rapid Need Assessment which has been conducted by White Hands Organization (through community participation) in the targeted area, the project has been designed to respond to the most critical needs of the newly displaced population by distributing 1,200 food baskets to 1,200 newly displaced families in Afrin district for six months. (1,200 family include 6,000 persons, 1,200 men, 1,500 women, 1,680 boys, and 1,620 girls). This is to insure IDPs’ food access through the most appropriate transfer modality which is in-kind food rations. The project will be implemented under the FSL activity which is: Provide coordinated life-saving assistance to displaced people from Idleb and Aleppo countryside, who are living in open random and informal settlements in the northern countryside of Aleppo. White Hands will identify, verify and profile target beneficiaries through community leaders, and local councils according to the following selection criteria: -Newly displaced families. -Women headed households (widows, divorced, GBV survivors). -Large families (more than 5) -Families with disabled members. -Families with low income (less than 50$) -Families with elderly (men-women). -Families with many children (under 18) Each family will receive one food basket (Monthly basis) , the basket will cover the need for one month, WH will distribute 7,200 food basket during the project (that mean 1,200 per month), each of these baskets is 78.3 kg, and it includes 2,100 kcal as (following FSL cluster recommendations) -White Hands will hold awareness sessions for the community, beneficiaries, and traders in the region on the project and distribution mechanism, at the beginning of the project The scoring system will be applied during the selection of beneficiaries to achieve community justice and accountability.
